meanings.definition: A person who vaults or leaps over something.
meanings.sent1: The vaultier effortlessly cleared the hurdle.
meanings.sent2: The talented vaultier won the gymnastics competition.
meanings.sent3: The vaultier decided to leap over the puddle instead of walking around it.
meanings.sent4: Like a skilled vaultier, the squirrel effortlessly hopped from branch to branch.
meanings.sent5: The circus performer was a fearless vaultier, jumping through hoops with grace.

meanings.sent1: This building is vaultier than the one next door.
meanings.sent2: The new design is vaultier than the old one.
meanings.sent3: The cake was so delicious, it made the other desserts seem vaultier.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was even vaultier than his, filling the room with joy.
meanings.sent5: The sunset painted the sky in shades of orange, making it look even vaultier than usual.

meanings.sent1: Of all the buildings in town, this one is the vaultiest.
meanings.sent2: She is the vaultiest dancer I have ever seen.
meanings.sent3: The cat thought it was the vaultiest creature in the house.
meanings.sent4: His love for her was the vaultiest feeling in his heart.
meanings.sent5: The mountain peak, covered in snow, looked even vaultier than the clouds above.
